The first production model of @theFarmHandTractor shipped this week.
The first #FarmHandTractor is going to @technomagik . Thank you for your patience. It has been quite a journey to take this from a prototype to the first production model, in less than a year. 
I will be starting the next batch after Christmas, and still have 2 more available if someone is interested. They are  $3,000 off of the base price of $9,500
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
MALT recently made a great video of farms who benefit enormously from ag land protection. Check it out on their website! I took this screen shot as it captured what makes the challenges of small scale farming and artisan cheese making so rewarding...the relationships and passion from the people. It wasn’t easy to capture this moment as everyone was more focused on work in the creamery and on the farm that needed to be done. 
-
It made me think about how there is little to no ego in this team of badass women who only care about the health of the land, animals, one another and making incredible cheese. Even though it was harder than herding sheep to get this shot it makes me happy to have this moment in time documented. Thank you @malt_ag and this incredible group of people! (Sadly a few were missing as it was their day off). 
-
-
#farmlandforever #bestteamever #tomales #tolumafarms #teamphoto #westmarin #sustainablefarming #smallscalefarming #farmsteadcreamery #team #womeninag #womenwhofarm

node.text:
Nous vous présentons Fisun Ercan, restauratrice et fondatrice de Bika Ferme et Cuisine.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
En 2018, Fisun et son mari rêvaient de créer un lieu où nourriture, communauté et agriculture prendraient tout leur sens. Ils imaginaient un endroit où ils pourraient partager leur amour pour la cuisine des aliments de la ferme.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Sa passion et son respect pour les techniques de culture ancestrales ne cessent de croître et ils sont en voie d'atteindre leur objectif zéro déchet : tout ce qu'ils récoltent est utilisé ou retourné à la terre. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Dans chaque numéro en français du Magazine Growers & Co., retrouvez un texte signé Caribou – un magazine qui met de l'avant la culture culinaire québécoise et les chefs qui participent au mouvement farm to table. Profitez d’un rabais de 10 % sur un abonnement au magazine Caribou avec le code promo : Growers. ⁠🍓
⁠⠀
___⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Meet Fisun Ercan, farm to table restauranteur and creator of Bika Farm & Cuisine.   ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
In 2018, Fisun and her husband had a dream of creating a place where food, community and growing all came to life. They dreamt of a place where they could share their love for farm to table cooking with others. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Her passion and respect for ancestral growing techniques has only grown, and they are now on track to be 100% waste-free, where everything they harvest is used or reintegrated back onto the land.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
In every French Growers & Co. Magazine edition, find an article by Caribou - a magazine that focuses on the culinary culture of Quebec and who discover farm to table chefs. Take advantage of a 10% discount when subscribing to Caribou magazine with the promo code: Growers. 📚
⁠⠀
📸 @daph.nico⁠⠀
🌱@bika_farm⁠⠀
✍🏼@cariboumagazine⁠ @vero_leduc 
⁠⠀
#growersandco #growers #smallfarms #marketgarden #smallscalefarming #growbetternotbigger #farmtotable #farmon #iamagrower #cultivacteur

Interested in weekly deliveries?

~⁠

Like so many growers, I've been a fan and a loyal customer of @johnnys_seeds for many years. Apart from their awesome tool selection, Johnny's sells high-quality seeds with amazing diversities of cultivars. It's ALWAYS reliable seeds 🍅 🥒🥦

As we're working on our corp planning for next year, their new catalog's arrival is SOOOO exciting 🤩

Here are cultivars that I'm stoked about and will be testing next summer. As anyone already trialed one of those? What do you think?
• Auroch
• Spinach Seeds
• The "new" winter density cold-hardy romaine salad
• Kelvin
• Celery Seed
• Subeto Organic Pelleted Beet
• Monty Broccoli Seed. We're always looking for heat-tolerant broccoli cultivars! 

This year's catalog also includes cultivars that we've been using and recommend:
• Seychelles
• Bean Seed, ideal for trellised pole beans
• Rossa di Milano, OP. a classic

🥕🥕🥕

Comme de nombreux producteurs, je suis un fan et un client fidèle de @johnnys_seeds depuis de nombreuses années. En plus de leur impressionnante sélection d'outils, Johnny's vend des semences de haute qualité avec une étonnante diversité de cultivars. Elles sont TOUJOURS super fiables 🍅 🥒🥦

Alors que nous travaillons à la planification culturale pour l'année prochaine, l'arrivée du nouveau catalogue est TROP excitante 🤩

Voici des cultivars que je testerai l'été prochain. Quelqu'un en a déjà testé un? Qu'en pensez-vous?
Auroch, Spinach Seeds, The "new" winter density cold-hardy romaine salad, Kelvin, Celery Seed, Subeto Organic Pelleted Beet, Monty Broccoli Seed...

Le catalogue de cette année comprend également des cultivars que nous utilisons et recommandons: Seychelles, Bean Seed, et Rossa di Milano, OP. un classique! 

#cropplanning #smallscalefarming #biointensive

Swiss chard is one of my favorite vegetables from the garden this time of year.  Started in mid summer, it still gives leaves in December.  It is one of the most impressive and nutrient-dense vegetables out there.

A testament to the range of antioxidants in Swiss chard nutrition is its deeply colored green leaves and also in the vibrant reds, purples and yellows of its multicolored stalks and veins.

How can you benefit from eating Swiss chard?

A diet that includes these beautiful leaves and stems gives you many forms of polyphenol, betalain and carotenoid phytonutrients, which are powerful at fighting free radical damage, inflammation and disease onset.

Swiss chard is a leafy green vegetable in the Amaranthaceae family that has the scientific name Beta vulgaris. Indeed, it is related to beets. 

What colorful veggies are you getting in your diet today?

#eattherainbow #rainbowchard #swisschard #amaranthaceae #acelga #yellowchard #yellowmakesmehappy #smallscalefarming #shegrows #vegetablegarden #vegetablegardening #beoutdoors #getyourhandsdirty #growfoodnotlawns #foodforest #zone1 #permaculture #agriculturabiologica

node.text:
Schon mal Brokkoli im Dezember geerntet? Nein? Ich bis heute auch nicht. Jep, bis heute!☝🏻😎
Die kühlen Monate nutze ich immer um zu testen was eigentlich auch trotz Kälte und weniger Sonnenlicht so wächst. Auch wenn die Köpfe noch etwas klein sind, bin ich schon ziemlich überrascht wie gut sie sich entwickelt haben und das obwohl es jetzt schon in der Nacht über einen längeren Zeitraum Minustemperaturen hat. Das Vlies erledigt scheinbar seine Arbeit recht ordentlich.
#winterfarming #marketgardening #smallscalefarming #brokkoli #broccoli #grünzeugvomfeld #mariajeutendorf #biogemüse #organicveggies #organic #organicgrower

node.text: We have had the honor to work with @pinnacleprevention on their new Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program. They are working to ensure that seniors, who are not able to shop at farmers markets, still have access to fresh, local produce. This is just one of the many amazing programs that Pinnacle Prevention are doing to improve the food systems in our community and we are grateful for all that they do.

In diesem dritten Teil der Videoreihe "Radikaler Realismus" untersuchen wir zusammen mit @la_via_campesina_official die Notwendigkeit der Wiederherstellung eines Ernährungssystems, das auf bäuerlicher Landwirtschaft, Agrarökologie und Ernährungssouveränität basiert.

Die Begrenzung der globalen Erwärmung auf 1,5°C über dem vorindustriellen Niveau ist machbar. Und sie ist unsere größte Chance, ökologische und soziale Gerechtigkeit zu erreichen und die Folgen einer globalen Krise einzudämmen, die aus historischer Ungerechtigkeit und höchst ungleicher Verantwortung entstanden ist.

Dazu bedarf es einer radikalen Abkehr von ressourcenintensiven und verschwenderischen Produktions- und Konsummustern und eines tiefgreifenden Wandels hin zu ökologischer Nachhaltigkeit und sozialer Gerechtigkeit. Diese Transformation zu fordern ist nicht "naiv" oder "politisch nicht durchführbar", sondern radikal realistisch.

#Climate #ClimateCrisis #ClimateProtection #Klimakrise #Klimawandel #Klima #RadikalerRealismus #RadicalRealism # #laviacampesina #agriculture #industrialAgriculture #Eco #Ecology #Landwirtschaft #öko #ökologisch #ökologischeLandwirtschaft #Agrarökologie #Ernährung #Food #Essen #smallscalefarming #climatefriendly #FoodSovereigntyNow #FoodSovereignty

Produktionstage sind immer unser Favorit. Nachdem wir den Kaffeesatz mit Stroh gemischt haben, geben wir ihn direkt in spezielle Pilzzuchtbeutel. Diese Beutel werden in einen Dampfer gegeben, um das Substrat zu pasteurisieren und alle Fremdkörper wie Schimmel oder Bakterien abzutöten. 
📷 @hipsterbinh

node.text:
New for 2021 Winterspring Farm ( was 2020 Wellspring) has agreed to offer our Farm’s Waggle Dance Flower bouquet subscriptions to all their CSA clients. Winterspring Farm is 8 miles from our farm even less miles as the crow flies. We at Willoway Farm are excited for our flowers to have a broader reach to folks who enjoy supporting locally produced products. New Flower stock / seed stock are finding there way to our farm for the 2021 season. I am excited to see the bounty of colors and freshness 2021 will hold. Thank you Winterspring Farm for letting us tag along!! 
*Consider gifting in season food & flowers this holiday season!! A gift that gives all season long and supports small businesses and local families!

node.text:
I går var en travl dag. Dels skulle der, som de øvrige dage i ugen, pakkes og afsendes bøger, og dels havde vi en aftale om at holde et indlæg/foredrag/samtale på Suhrs Højskole. Sidstnævnte var omgærdet af tvivl grundet den seneste udvikling i smitten, og efter at have filet frem og tilbage, først med en aflysning og dernæst med en nedskaleret udgave, endte det med, at vi satte os i bilen, kørte til København og underholdt de lovende unge mennesker.

Om en anden måde at have landbrug på. Om husdyr, nøjsomhed, vilje, muligheder, industrielt landbrug, bier, sprøjtegifte, naturudvikling m.m. De var vågne, interesserede og stillede en lang række vedkommende spørgsmål. Det talte handlede som udgangspunkt om gården her, dyrkningsformen, samlivet med dyrene osv. for jeg tænkte, at der er så rigeligt at være deprimeret og bekymret over for tiden, ikke mindst den manglende indsats på klimaområdet. Man kan ikke spille skak med en hockeystav.

Udover det talte medbragte forlagsdirektøren to kasser med eksemplarer af “Mad vs. Fødevarer” til uddeling blandt elever og lærere og således kan de selv fordybe sig yderligere i fødevaresystemets påvirkning. Af os alle.

#suhrs #klimakaos #klima #landliv #smallscalefarming #countrylife #landliv #bæredygtig #detflydendeforlag #økologiskdyrking #northernliving #sustainableliving #flowerpower #mangfoldighed #grapes

node.text: My husband has been busy working on the outside walk-in cooler.  Insulation for the walk-in cooler was another huge cost.  He installed 43 sheets of foam insulation in the walk-in cooler.  The R value is 30.  It is 2” thick rigid foam board from our local home improvement store.  The foam board went on all the walls, flooring, and ceiling.  Plywood was installed over the foam insulation.  The plywood protects the foam board from getting damaged.  He applied a paint with a primer to the plywood.  He also installed a vinyl flooring on the floor.  Next, he will install the CoolBot unit. The CoolBot recommendation for insulation is at least R25.  The standalone walk-in cooler is possible from a grant from NC AgVentures.  #ncagventures #ncstateextension #nctobaccotrustfund #growingsmallfarms #coolbotcooler #flowerfarmer #ncflowerfarmer #womenwhofarmflowers #storingdahlias #dahliastorage

node.text:
Check out the nesting box set up @the_frenchiefarm. Best part? Little ones can climb up and collect their own eggs too! 🐓 What does your nesting box situation look like? 

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @the_frenchiefarm

“Frenchie Farm is an organic and regenerative family farm raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, Great Pyrenees, and pasture raised chickens, ducks, and broiler chickens. We provide farm classes for kids dedicated to teaching children about sustainable farming. Frenchie Farm also sells seasonally appropriate farm-to-table goods, including but not limited to, pasture raised chicken + duck eggs, pasture raised broiler chickens, honey, and seasonal produce.”

In an effort to live a more simplified life with intention and gratitude, our family made the decision to pursue modern homesteading. We grow as much of our own food as possible in our garden while also raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, chickens, and bees.”

Chicago, Illinois
📸: @the_frenchiefarm

Peashoots looking dam fine in the micro room over at @ambercottageflowers HQ. DM for orders, £3/100g.
.
To make it worth our while growing indoors, we try to ensure each of these flats generate an income of atleast £9. The peashoots average out at around 300g per flat, meeting our requirements. x4 flats per tray.
.
This covers the cost of seed, compost, electricity and a little of our time. We find that radish microgreens also achieve good yeilds and are easily salable. It has been tough this yeah though as many of my restaurant customers have either closed or at the very least, been heavily impacted by #covid19
.
.
.

node.text:
We’d like to thank everyone who has bought our chicken at the Mullum markets the last few weeks! So much amazing feedback and return customers that put a massive smile on our face. 🤗

We won’t be there this week as we have sold all the chickens from the last batch! Next week will be a big one for us. Starting with slaughtering chickens, then packing, butchering, delivering, and returning to the markets Dec 11th, with a fresh batch of chickens. Processing ourselves is not easy nor cheap, however, this is a key element in how we bring the best quality chicken available to market. We’ll have whole birds and the range of cuts, all with that signature full flavour and juiciness. 

Looking forward to bringing the community our happy soil building chooks next week

🐓

node.text:
2020.12.03 早餐

好久沒有放上餐桌的照片。每天每週都還是有在上菜，但年底事情多，寫字的時間少了，荒廢ig好一陣子。

今天的早餐是煙燻鮭魚生菜番茄三明治。是的又是生菜的季節了！每週上山，總是有採不完的生菜葉，我最喜歡的是綠火焰，清脆鮮甜的口感很清爽，翠綠的顏色總是能為食物加分。其次是奶油萵苣，柔軟甜嫩的葉片也非常好吃。今年也有種紅萵苣。山上比較冷又常下雨，生菜孩子們長得很開心！

這份三明治中的滑蛋加了芥末籽醬一起炒，讓味道更豐富。噢還加了小番茄，彩色小蕃茄是古東喜家的，超、級、好、吃，不是只有甜味，各式小蕃茄滋味不盡相同，酸酸甜甜的，非常好吃！

早上的咖啡是音樂家系列的蕭邦，入口有花香味，好好喝！

#一籃菜 #自給自足 #家庭菜園 #無農薬 #smallscalefarming #organic #ecofriendly #organicfarming #urbanfarming #organicfood #farming #産地直送 #都市農場 #都市農業 #野菜 #breakfast #早餐 #朝食 #foodphotography #foodporn #foodstagram #foodie #healthyfood #料理 #自炊 #料理写真

node.text:
Yesterday we noticed St. Johns Wort growing along our creek and cow paddock fence line, so this morning we got up early to beat the heat and pulled it out. We have white skinned cows and if enough St. Johns Wort is ingested by the cow it can cause photosensitivity, it’s a horrible thing and causes their fur to fall out and their skin blisters and burns/peels off (don’t google it if your squeamish). Thankfully it hasn’t spread too far and we only had to pick a couple of sprigs out of the cow pasture, not nearly enough to cause any damage. 
St Johns isn’t all bad though, chances are you’ve seen it in capsule form in the chemist. I used to buy them for their anti inflammatory properties when I was first diagnosed with my auto immune diseases. Now we have it readily available to dry out and use for tea when I feel like I have a flare up coming on but it can be used for many other ailments as well, most commonly, mild mood imbalances. It’s really important to be 100% sure of your weed identification when picking for consumption, I use multiple books (my favorites being The Wondrous World of Weeds by Pat Collins and The Weed Forager’s Handbook) and ask locals to double check my identification. It amazes me that I used to spend around $30 for something that grows so readily. While it’s not ideal to have it near the cows I think we can coexist if we’re diligent. On that note, there’s plenty to share if anyone would like some posted when the flowers have dried 🌼🌼

node.text:
Farm lessons from 2020:
.
This yard trialed 2 experiments this year. First, we used silage tarps to occult the fiendish chickweed. Second, we dumped, like dumped, compost on beds and did not till or flip the soil. Just piled on compost and then raked the compost level and then seeded. My strategy was to keep the weed seeds below and build the soil up.
.
The results were mostly positive. Eventually some chickweed came back. But our germination rate on lettuce was thick, so we managed to get great yields before and typically 2 harvests before the chickweed came in heavy. Then we weedwhacked and added more compost and then reseeded. At the end of the season we out the silage tarp back on. Stay tuned for next season when a new farmer owner reveals the gorgeous black earth underneath.
.
📸 @vreshprince
.
.
.
#farmsale #yycnow #grandtrunkveg #grandtrunkveggies #gtv #calgarynow #calgaryfood #yycliving #yycbusiness #smallscalefarming #yycsmallbusiness #compost #notillgardening #notillfarming #farm2020 #yyclife #yycforsale #albertaag #yrbanfarm #urbanfarmer #cfsaladbox #yycgrowers #yycgardening #calgarygardening #calgarybuzz #yycbuzz #yycbiz

node.text: We could not have planned this. Yesterday we did a post about how we are giving away ten copies of the book Crop Planning for Organic Vegetable Growers, because we have accumulated damaged copies we couldn’t sell over the decade it has been in print. And today what should arrive, but a fresh box of Crop Planning, with a big hole in the top! It is printed in Canada and shipped to us in Maine, must be a rough trip across the border! We’re giving away all ten of those copies you see in the picture. To win one, go to the link in profile and open our email newsletter from yesterday for the link, or you can go straight to https://mailchi.mp/growingformarket/dec120newsletter until noon Monday 12/7. Good luck! While you’re there, sign up for a free webinar by Crop Planning author Daniel Brisebois on December 8!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Growing For Market Magazine in Cornville, Maine.

node.text:
Hello.... GOURDgeous! ⁣
⁣
So I intended on posting this early in November but shit happens 🤷‍♀️ ⁣
⁣
But hey yall really take the opportunity this time of the year to shop locally. Businesses are suffering, families are losing their dream shops & stands and, as a result, autonomy is suffering. ⁣
⁣
The collective is suffering. ⁣
⁣
We always want to talk about how this part of the year is the time of giving.. so why not give through showing up for one another? Through supporting the collective? One small purchase could make a large difference in these peoples lives. ⁣
⁣
I’m not telling you all to cancel your Amazon Prime account. I know that 2 day shipping is a wonderful privilege. I’m just saying do both!!⁣
⁣
Why not!?!? Fill your Amazon cart with goods while you stroll through a local artisan shop for that fabulous & unique piece of art you want to gift to your creative friend, or (if you wanna know what to get me) some yummy treats from the small bakery outside of town. ⁣
⁣
So please, support local businesses & markets at this time! And just wear a frickin’ mask while ya shop! ⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
#shoplocally #smallscalefarming #smallbusiness #supportsmallbusiness #supportlocalmakers #localmarket #farmersmarket #soulardmarket #stl #support #christmas #december #gourds #pumpkin

Our Properly Free Range Turkey Breast is a perfect cut for those who prefer the white meat of the bird, or if you’re catering for just a few this Christmas🎄🦃

Our Turkey Breast has a sensational depth of flavour which is in part derived from the fabulous free range life of the bird, along with the addition of hanging each bird for 12 days.

If you are looking for a simple, hassle-free meal that still delivers big on flavour then our Properly Free Range Turkey Breast is a great choice.

We only have a limited number of Christmas delivery slots left, so don’t delay and place your order as soon as possible 💫

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Natalie in Lüneburg, Germany. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
